Title: Data Operations Associate
Description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

The Data Operations team is responsible for the core of what we do as a company: delivering high quality data on the private markets to thousands of discerning customers. This is done through our various data collection processes consisting of web-based data scraping, entering of data from publicly available documents, web researching of hard-to-find information, and direct communication with executives, investors, and advisors involved in transactions and fundraising.  

A Data Operations Associate’s initial focus is to master our in-house developed Research Tool Suite (RTS). Once mastered, they will help the team to ensure the operations of the dataset meet PitchBook’s high standards while continually increasing the efficiency of the team. Their focus will be on the secondary side of the Data Operations team’s operations, which focuses on the collection and validation of data from publicly available sources using proprietary research methodology. 

Primary Job Responsibilities:


Become proficient in one of PitchBook’s core data areas of operation, including private equity, venture capital, M&A, or Institutional Investors
Leverage our in-house database, business intelligence reports, and other technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is audited and added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently while adhering to complex research tracking methodologies to ensure that data is of the utmost quality
Consistently provide quality customer service and respond to requests from internal and external customers daily
Provide training and ramping support to new members of the team, both locally and abroad
Gather team feedback and utilize PowerBI reports to identify root causes of systemic data problems and drive operational, methodological, and RTS Database improvements
Regularly collaborate with Secondary team and the broader Data Operations department to develop and improve processes, tools, and methodologies; identifying opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
Work closely with our Data Operations team in Mumbai to achieve profile production targets. This relationship includes auditing the Mumbai team’s work as well as joining calls to share best practices and process improvement ideas
Communicate effectively and efficiently with your team and other stakeholders to provide updates on project progress, address roadblocks, and celebrate wins
Assist senior members of the Data Operations department on the execution of strategic initiatives and operational goals
Support the vision and values of the company by setting an example and demonstrating desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree
1+ years of work experience, including any internship experience
Experience with SQL and/or Python required
Experience or exposure to financial markets or services, particularly private equity and venture capital
Exemplary verbal and written communication skills; comfortable to engage a diverse array of audiences
Ability to operate with a strong sense of urgency and deliver results
Self-motivated and goal-oriented attitude and can work effectively as an individual or as part of a team
Analytical and process-oriented with a dedication to continuous improvement
Ability to problem solve and use judgment to make decisions within ambiguous research situations 
Approach each task with an entrepreneurial spirit and intellectual curiosity
Strong organization skills with attention to detail
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily



Benefits + Compensation at PitchBook:

Physical Health


Comprehensive health benefits
Additional medical wellness incentives
STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance



Emotional Health


Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid family and paternity leave
Annual educational stipend
Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
CFA exam stipend
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Employee assistance program
Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days



Social Health


Matching gifts program
Employee resource groups
Subsidized emergency childcare
Dependent Care FSA
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events



Financial Health


401k match
Shared ownership employee stock program
Monthly transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.



Compensation


This position is non-exempt and paid a salary of $72,000-$72,000
Target annual bonus percentage: 7.5%



Working Conditions:

At the heart of our company is a belief in the power of in-person collaboration. Being together in the office fuels our creativity, strengthens our connections, and drives the innovation that sets us apart. Our culture is built on spontaneous moments—those hallway conversations, whiteboard brainstorms, and shared celebrations in each of our global offices—that simply can’t be replicated remotely. This role is expected to be in the office 5 days a week.

The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

Life At PB:

We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It’s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.


Show more
HTML:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

The Data Operations team is responsible for the core of what we do as a company: delivering high quality data on the private markets to thousands of discerning customers. This is done through our various data collection processes consisting of web-based data scraping, entering of data from publicly available documents, web researching of hard-to-find information, and direct communication with executives, investors, and advisors involved in transactions and fundraising.  

A Data Operations Associate’s initial focus is to master our in-house developed Research Tool Suite (RTS). Once mastered, they will help the team to ensure the operations of the dataset meet PitchBook’s high standards while continually increasing the efficiency of the team. Their focus will be on the secondary side of the Data Operations team’s operations, which focuses on the collection and validation of data from publicly available sources using proprietary research methodology. 

Primary Job Responsibilities:

  • Become proficient in one of PitchBook’s core data areas of operation, including private equity, venture capital, M&A, or Institutional Investors
  • Leverage our in-house database, business intelligence reports, and other technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is audited and added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently while adhering to complex research tracking methodologies to ensure that data is of the utmost quality
  • Consistently provide quality customer service and respond to requests from internal and external customers daily
  • Provide training and ramping support to new members of the team, both locally and abroad
  • Gather team feedback and utilize PowerBI reports to identify root causes of systemic data problems and drive operational, methodological, and RTS Database improvements
  • Regularly collaborate with Secondary team and the broader Data Operations department to develop and improve processes, tools, and methodologies; identifying opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
  • Work closely with our Data Operations team in Mumbai to achieve profile production targets. This relationship includes auditing the Mumbai team’s work as well as joining calls to share best practices and process improvement ideas
  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with your team and other stakeholders to provide updates on project progress, address roadblocks, and celebrate wins
  • Assist senior members of the Data Operations department on the execution of strategic initiatives and operational goals
  • Support the vision and values of the company by setting an example and demonstrating desired behaviors
  • Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested


Skills and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 1+ years of work experience, including any internship experience
  • Experience with SQL and/or Python required
  • Experience or exposure to financial markets or services, particularly private equity and venture capital
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills; comfortable to engage a diverse array of audiences
  • Ability to operate with a strong sense of urgency and deliver results
  • Self-motivated and goal-oriented attitude and can work effectively as an individual or as part of a team
  • Analytical and process-oriented with a dedication to continuous improvement
  • Ability to problem solve and use judgment to make decisions within ambiguous research situations 
  • Approach each task with an entrepreneurial spirit and intellectual curiosity
  • Strong organization skills with attention to detail
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily


Benefits + Compensation at PitchBook:

Physical Health

  • Comprehensive health benefits
  • Additional medical wellness incentives
  • STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance


Emotional Health

  • Paid sabbatical program after four years
  • Paid family and paternity leave
  • Annual educational stipend
  • Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
  • CFA exam stipend
  • Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
  • Employee assistance program
  • Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days


Social Health

  • Matching gifts program
  • Employee resource groups
  • Subsidized emergency childcare
  • Dependent Care FSA
  • Company-wide events
  • Employee referral bonus program
  • Quarterly team building events


Financial Health

  • 401k match
  • Shared ownership employee stock program
  • Monthly transportation stipend
  • Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.


Compensation

  • This position is non-exempt and paid a salary of $72,000-$72,000
  • Target annual bonus percentage: 7.5%


Working Conditions:

At the heart of our company is a belief in the power of in-person collaboration. Being together in the office fuels our creativity, strengthens our connections, and drives the innovation that sets us apart. Our culture is built on spontaneous moments—those hallway conversations, whiteboard brainstorms, and shared celebrations in each of our global offices—that simply can’t be replicated remotely. The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

Title: Product Growth Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for growth leaders for products used by billions of people and businesses all over the world across our apps including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus. This is a leadership opportunity to drive impact end-to-end through the product development life cycle. The product growth analyst role is embedded within product teams and requires using a mix of skills including analysis, product ideation, and cross-functional collaboration. Success in the role is tied directly to product goals and the team rewards results-based performance.The Growth practice was started right here at Meta, putting you at the forefront of the industry with great opportunity to learn about growth from experts. It is a lean and highly regarded team with an emphasis on regular sharing of successful strategies, tactics and insights across products. Our team values are to own the outcome, focus on driving sustainable impact, and put team success first. There is great opportunity to be a leader and influence the direction of high-visibility and high-impact initiatives, and to have your work come to life in some of the most widely used apps in the world.

Product Growth Analyst Responsibilities:


Lead growth strategy across a large product area and drive cross-team alignment
Drive long term growth of Meta Inc products through a combination of data analysis, product ideation, and experimentation to optimize product experiences
Understand trends in user behavior and product usage to influence growth strategy
Identify opportunities to drive growth and prioritize them to maximize long-term growth
Execute on projects by working closely with engineering and other members of product teams to land impact on product goals. Lead experimentation from designing tests to analyzing results that lead to launch decisions


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience
6+ years of experience working in an analytical or product role
Proven to effectively collaborate across variety of technical and non-technical functions to drive towards common product goals
Experience working with and influencing multi disciplinary product teams consisting but not limited to software engineers, designers, product managers and data scientists
Proficiency in quantitative analysis geared towards drawing actionable insights from complex datasets
Experience performing exploratory analysis with minimal direction to answer ambiguous open ended questions
Experimentation experience to design multivariate tests, synthesize test results and build frameworks to make data-informed launch decisions
Product ideation skills to apply growth tactics broadly to different product areas and think through detailed elements of a product experience
Experience with data querying languages (for example, SQL)
Experience working on a product or service used by a wide-range of communities


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$133,000/year to $185,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Marketing/Advertisement Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Marketing/Advertisement Data Analyst with a desire to excel? If so, then Talent Software Services may have the job for you! Our client is seeking an experienced Marketing/Advertisement Data Analyst to work at their company in Redmond, WA.




Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

Purpose of the Team: The main function of a Data Analyst is to support digital marketers by analyzing marketing campaign performance and impact. This includes supporting campaign setup for measurement and tracking, as well as researching and defining audience segments for emails.

Key Projects:
This role will support one line of business with a heavy focus on email. The team is initiating a project for new data measurement techniques for retention and engagement emails.
Campaign Analysis and Reporting: Analyze campaign performance and prepare reports, including generating insights and data storytelling for presentations.
Audience Research and Targeting: Research data sources to define campaign audiences, contributing to the planning phase before campaign launches.
Data Preparation and Presentation: Prepare data, create presentations, and communicate complex analysis results to stakeholders.

Typical Task Breakdown and Operating Rhythm: The role will consist of 60% data analysis, 20% meetings, and 20% preparing for presentations, communications, and updating preliminary data.

Conduct in-depth ad hoc analysis to uncover audience behaviors, performance drivers, and opportunities for optimization across email campaigns.
Perform research to support the creation and refinement of personalized targeting signals using cross-channel data sources.
Collaborate with marketing, product, analytics, and engineering teams to align on data requirements, insights, and targeting strategies.
Derive meaningful business insights by exploring large datasets, identifying patterns, and translating findings into actionable targeting opportunities.




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience with PowerPoint (Ability to create clear, effective presentations to communicate data analysis findings)
Minimum 2-3 years experience with Power BI and Adobe Analytics (for data analysis and reporting)
Minimum 5 years experience with advanced Excel (data manipulation, formulas, pivot tables, some statistical analysis)
Previous experience with Ads platforms is a plus.
Strong Communication: Ability to clearly present and explain complex data and analysis results to stakeholders is essential.
Data Storytelling: Skill in preparing presentations and conveying insights from data in an understandable way.
Collaboration: Work with marketers and other team members during campaign planning and results presentation.
Attention to Detail: Required for accurate analysis, reporting, and audience research.
Knowledge of data is part of the planning phase before campaign launch.
Performance Indicators: Performance will be assessed based on the delivery of results on a monthly basis, ability to lead presentations and meet deadlines, collaboration, and responsiveness with the team.
Years of Experience Required: 5-7 years of experience in the field.
Degrees or Certifications Required: A degree in computer science, marketing, statistics, or a related field in data analytics is required.
Show more

Title: Performance Data Analyst - FT
Description:
Description

If you are looking for employment with a purpose where you can help improve the daily lives of the members of your community, then consider a career with Pioneer Human Services!

We are currently looking for a Performance Data Analyst/Manager with a passion for human services. This is an exciting opportunity to be involved with an organization focused on racial justice, second opportunities, diversity, equity and inclusion.

WHO WE ARE - Our Mission

We empower justice-involved individuals to overcome adversity and reach their full potential.

For over 60 years, we have proudly serviced our clients with professionalism and empathy. We are a nationally recognized non-profit with 35+ locations across Washington state that provided a chance for change to over 9,500 individuals in 2024.

What We Offer

At Pioneer, our employees are important. That’s why we offer a Total Rewards package that includes compensation and benefits to support employees' health, security, and balance.

Compensation

New hires start between $82 501 and $110 002 based on experience, qualifications, skills, competencies, internal equity, and market factors. While the full pay range is listed for this position for pay transparency, individual compensation is determined by various factors and may vary within the posted range.

Benefits

Eligible after 30 days of full-time employment (minimum of 30 hours/week):


Medical
Flexible spending
Dental
Vision


Additional Coverage After 60 Days


Life
AD&D
Disability


Other Benefits


Dependent Daycare Flexible Spending
Tuition assistance (100% for bachelor's, 50% for graduate programs)
Retirement plan (3.5% annual compensation contribution, plus 3.5% match for 6% individual contribution)
Employee recognition programs
Public transportation discount
Employee assistance program (EAP)


What You'll Do

The Performance Data Analyst plays a strategic role in advancing data-driven decision-making across the organization. This position leads the design, implementation, delivery, and maintenance of performance measurement, evaluation and visualization data and systems that support program improvement, strategic planning, and accountability. The ideal candidate combines analytical expertise with a passion for mission-driven work, using data to enhance impact, equity, and effectiveness across all services and segments of Pioneer Human Services.

Primary/Essential Duties And Responsibilities


Develop and oversee systems for collecting, cleaning, managing, and analyzing programmatic and operational data.
Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to uncover trends, disparities, and improvement opportunities.
Partner with program teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs), outcomes, and benchmarks aligned to strategic goals.
Perform root cause analysis to inform continuous quality improvement and strategic decision-making.
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) for diverse internal and external stakeholders.
Deliver accurate, timely, and actionable reports to inform internal operations, funders, and policy advocacy.
Design and implement data collection instruments, including surveys, using applicable and modern platforms.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Shared Services, program teams, evaluation, development, and communications to align data systems with organizational strategy.
Train and support staff in data literacy, tool usage, and interpretation of results.
Support storytelling and impact reporting through data visualization and synthesis.
Ensure data integrity, consistency, and privacy through documented standards and protocols.
Maintain compliance with HIPAA, FERPA, and other applicable privacy regulations.
Support the development of a strong internal data governance culture.


Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and at least one data analysis or business intelligence tool (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, SQL, R, Python).
Strong skills in data wrangling, visualization, and interpretation for diverse technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with results-based frameworks (e.g., logic models, Results-Based Accountability).
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Excellent written, visual, and verbal communication skills.
Analytical thinking and sound judgment to resolve complex problems and anticipate risks.
Builds strong working relationships through empathy, active listening, and a respectful, team-oriented approach.
Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion principles


Qualifications

REQUIRED


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Public Policy, Public Health, Social Sciences, or related field.
A minimum of 4 years of experience in performance measurement, evaluation, analytics, or applied data roles.
An equivalent of combination of education and experience.
Experience with relational databases and CRM or case management systems (e.g., Salesforce, Apricot, Efforts to Outcomes).


Preferred/Desirable


Master’s degree in relevant field.
Experience working in human services, public sector, nonprofit, or social enterprise settings.
Experience supporting grant reporting, program evaluation, or outcomes research.


EEO

Pioneer human services is an equal opportunity employer of minorities/women/individuals with disabilities/protected veterans and does not unlawfully discriminate under federal, state, or local laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. EEOC is the Law/EEO Policy Statement

Pioneer Human Services is a Drug-Free Company

Pioneer Human Services is a drug free company. This position has been deemed safety sensitive under RCW 49.44.240(3) and is subject to both pre-employment drug testing and drug testing during employment, to include testing for marijuana.

Title: Business Analyst, TOM Analytics and Insights, TOM Analytics and Insights
Description:
Description

Amazon's Transportation Operations Management (TOM) team is seeking an analytical and customer-obsessed Business Analyst to transform complex operational data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. You will partner with cross-functional teams to optimize yard operations, improve infrastructure planning, and enhance the overall transportation network efficiency through data-driven solutions.

Key job responsibilities


Build and maintain automated reporting systems and dashboards using TOM's data infrastructure (QuickSight, internal tools) to monitor KPIs and drive operational improvements
Partner with key stakeholders (Operations, Planning, Training, Yard, Driving, Gate/Tech, Products etc.) to develop metrics, reporting solutions and process improvements that align with business objectives.
Design and implement scalable analytics solutions focused on yard design, launch planning, and future transportation infrastructure concepts
Leverage TOM's unified data platform to create single source of truth datasets and insights that support strategic planning and operational excellence
Lead requirements gathering sessions and translate business needs into technical specifications for analytics solutions
Develop and maintain documentation of analytical processes, metrics definitions, and standard operating procedures
Present data-driven recommendations to stakeholders and senior leadership to influence strategic decisions
Create analytical frameworks and roadmaps that enable the team to scale analytics capabilities alongside business growth


Basic Qualifications


5+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
5+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience partnering with executive-level leaders to identifying and solving business issues

Job ID: A3032750

Title: Sr. Data Analyst, Finance
Description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

The Finance Platform team focuses on enterprise tools, systems, automation, integration, and workflow development within the broader Finance Operations group, which is part of Revenue Operations (RevOps) alongside Sales & Customer Success Operations and Marketing Operations.

As a Senior Data Analyst specializing in Finance at PitchBook, you play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive financial analysis, reporting, and decision-making processes. You will utilize data sourced from various repositories, including Snowflake as part of our Enterprise Data Platform (and associated data products), to construct insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics products tailored to address specific questions and uncover actionable insights. Your analytical skills and understanding of financial metrics will enable you to provide valuable visibility into financial performance metrics and KPIs, supporting data-driven strategies and initiatives. Building upon your extensive experience, you will not only analyze data but also provide strategic guidance and mentorship to less experienced team members. You actively contribute to shaping the overall data strategy of the organization, collaborating with senior leadership to align data initiatives with broader business objectives and drive organizational growth.

Primary Job Responsibilities:


Analyze financial data across multiple systems, including ERP, CRM, and business intelligence tools, to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization
Translate complex datasets into understandable insights for stakeholders. Provide deep insights into data trends, leveraging advanced analytical methodologies
Design and develop purpose-built dashboards and reports to track financial metrics and KPIs
Ensure accuracy, relevance, and accessibility of reporting tools for end-users. Implement automated reporting solutions to streamline data delivery processes
Customize reports and dashboards to meet the specific needs of finance users, enabling informed decision-making
Identify opportunities for automation within financial processes, such as budgeting, forecasting, and reconciliation
Work with Finance Platform and Finance teams to implement solutions that streamline workflows and reduce manual effort
Generate actionable insights from data analysis to drive finance strategy. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions
Provide training and support to finance users on analytics functionality, report generation, and data analysis techniques
Ensure the integrity and quality of sales and finance data by implementing data governance best practices
Lead initiatives to enhance data quality and integrity across marketing datasets
Independently engage with internal customers regarding their analytics needs and deliver on them
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, customer success, product, and finance, to align data analysis efforts with business objectives
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, or related field. Master’s degree preferred
5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact
Prior experience in a senior or lead analyst role preferred
Previous experience supporting finance or revenue operations teams required
Expert proficiency in SQL for complex querying, data manipulation, and performance tuning
Extensive experience with Snowflake or similar data warehousing platforms
Advanced analytical skills, including experience with statistical modeling, and proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R is highly desirable
Demonstrated expertise in developing sophisticated dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Experience with dashboard automation and customization through scripting languages is a plus
Comprehensive understanding of finance concepts and metrics, with the ability to provide strategic guidance to finance leaders
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with a proven ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences
Experience leading workshops or training sessions on data analytics topics is advantageous
Keen attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and quality assurance
Experience implementing data validation and data cleansing techniques preferred
Strong leadership and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively lead conversations with cross-functional teams and drive consensus on data-driven strategies in a fast-paced and dynamic environment



Benefits + Compensation at PitchBook:

Physical Health


Comprehensive health benefits
Additional medical wellness incentives
STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance



Emotional Health


Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid family and paternity leave
Annual educational stipend
Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
CFA exam stipend
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Employee assistance program
Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days



Social Health


Matching gifts program
Employee resource groups
Subsidized emergency childcare
Dependent Care FSA
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events



Financial Health


401k match
Shared ownership employee stock program
Monthly transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.



Compensation


Annual base salary: $115,000-$130,000
Target annual bonus percentage: 10%



Working Conditions:

At the heart of our company is a belief in the power of in-person collaboration. Being together in the office fuels our creativity, strengthens our connections, and drives the innovation that sets us apart. Our culture is built on spontaneous moments—those hallway conversations, whiteboard brainstorms, and shared celebrations in each of our global offices—that simply can’t be replicated remotely. This role is expected to be in the office 5 days a week.

The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

Life At PB:

We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It’s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.

Title: Data Collection Researcher
Description:
Seattle, WA (onsite)

IntePros is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Collection Researcher to join our customer research and data collection team. In this role, you’ll manage end-to-end data collection processes, contribute to process improvements, and collaborate closely with engineering and research teams to enhance software usability and participant experiences.

Key Responsibilities


Oversee data collection activities, including managing Qualtrics surveys (online surveys for collecting customer or participant feedback), ETL workflows (extracting, cleaning, and loading data for analysis), monitoring participant engagement, and delivering daily reports.
Lead defined projects to improve data collection processes and participant experiences.
Partner with cross-functional teams to streamline workflows and recommend process enhancements.
Maintain a high level of accuracy, confidentiality, and professionalism in all tasks.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.
5+ years of relevant experience in data collection or customer research.
Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and adapt to shifting priorities.
Experience handling confidential information with integrity and discretion.
Proficiency with platforms like Qualtrics and a proven track record of delivering high-quality work under tight timelines.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in speech and language data collection and processing.
Hands-on experience with all stages of data collection (recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting).
Background in consumer electronics research or customer service.
A proactive mindset, positive attitude, and strong teamwork skills.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Fraud (SMB)
Description:
Job Description

Remitly's vision is to transform lives with trusted financial services that transcend borders. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to people who send money around the world. Today, we are reimagining global financial services and building products that extend beyond traditional barriers to give customers access to more of the services they need, no matter where they call home. Join over 2,700 employees worldwide who are growing their careers with purpose and connection with our customers while having a positive impact on millions of people around the globe.

About The Role

The Senior Data Analyst, Fraud (SMB) will report to Remitly's Director, Risk Analytics. In this role, you will apply data science and analytics techniques to drive rapid, rational decision-making within Remitly's core product. You will understand internal fraud systems and customize solutions for SMB that mitigate fraud risk enabling fast growth of the lending product. You'll contribute to SMB product development by enabling customer centric controls that prevent fraud while streamlining the experience for non fraudulent customers by partnering with program and product managers, engineers, analysts, and designers. You'll report to the Director of Analytics. This is a hybrid role that requires 2-3 days a week at our Seattle, WA headquarters.

You Will


Become an expert on Remitly's risk management systems and customer experience
Build a unified understanding of how SMB / Fraud data, customer experiences, and goals align
Own metrics used to evaluate SMB system performance and customer friction
Formulate hypotheses, design and evaluate product experiments
Generate insights and help define & execute longer term product strategies and roadmaps across multiple product teams


You Have


5+ years in a data analyst role or similar full-time, professional experience
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, engineering, economics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent additional experience)
Intermediate SQL Proficiency
Working knowledge of Python or R for data analysis
Expertise with statistical concepts (e.g. A/B testing, probability theory, forecasting) and how they can be applied in real-world situations
Experience distilling business problems, developing hypotheses, building an analytical framework, carrying out an analysis, and writing a clear recommendation
Strong data storytelling skills, including data visualization, technical writing, and business writing
Experience finding creative solutions within the constraints of complex systems and policies


Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is typically $128,000 - $150,000. In the U.S., Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Our Benefits


Flexible paid time off
Health, dental, and vision + 401k plan with company matching
Paid parental, medical, military and family care leave
Mental Health & Family Forming Benefits
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Continuing education and travel benefits


We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman's potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.

Remitly is an E-Verify Employer

Remitly is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job#: 2080519

Job Description:

Senior Data Analyst - Regulatory Reporting & Content Moderation

Onsite in Redmond, WA 3-4 days onsite/week.

Chance for Extension (Y/N): Highly Likely

This role is in terms of convenience and collaboration with team, partner with different teams and it would be significant for them to come in in-person. Nature of work is not something they should be isolated doing remotely; lots of partnership

Typical Day in the Role

Purpose of the Team: The purpose of this team is data analytics to gather insights and experiences team for the larger gaming team.

Key projects: This role will be a part of the team that supports safety and compliance regulatory systems. The role will work with the team on emerging regulatory requirements and gathering, processing data per regulations as regulations are updated. Some data that will be handled includes content moderation, player safety data, how the content moderation is working, safety classifications, some end user data, and more. The role will work with stakeholders to gather resources, and build reports for the team. The role will write SQL queries and use various tools including apache spark platform to own end-to-end delivery and tell stories using data. The role will also support infrastructure and collaboration, working with player safety team and collaborating with them and upstream partners to set up processes and collect data points to build dashboards and reports. The role will manage queries independently, advise others on parameters, partner with other internal teams to build a data story around content moderation. The role will also communicate the data story and present this in meetings to stakeholders, and review documentation and advise next steps to stakeholders as well.

Typical task breakdown and operating rhythm: The role will consist of a check in/stand up meeting every day, and various meetings with stakeholders or upstream partners occasionally. The role will be around 20% meetings, 20% data analysis, 50% building code/reports/dashboards, 10% presenting to stakeholders.

Compelling Story & Candidate Value Proposition

What makes this role interesting? - This role provides the opportunity to work on a large gaming team and do the hard work that keeps a gaming studio successful.

Candidate Requirements


Years of Experience Required: 8 overall years of experience in the field.
Degrees or certifications required: A Bachelor’s degree in a related field is required to be eligible for this role.
Disqualifiers: Candidates that are not strong presenters or do not have the required skills will not be eligible for the role.
Best vs. Average: The ideal resume would contain a technical background and a strong background in regulation and moderation. Previous experience in the gaming industry is nice to see. The ideal candidate is a self starter and excels at taking on tasks and driving completion themselves without micromanagement. Previous experience working with partners and stakeholders, strong data analysis, and experience with platforms like Databricks, Apache Spark, etc. is very helpful.
Performance Indicators: Performance will be assessed based on quality of data gathered and ability to support the team.


Top 3 Hard Skills Required + Years of Experience


Minimum 5 years experience with advanced SQL and Python scripting to build and optimize complex queries, preferably with platforms like Databricks, Apache Spark, etc.
Minimum 5 years experience with PowerBI producing dashboards and reports
Minimum 5 years experience with cross functional teams to gather data, then reporting on and presenting data insights to stakeholders.


Hard Skills Assessments


Expected Dates that Hard Skills Assessments will be scheduled: Week of July 22nd and afterwards
Hard Skills Assessment Process: The assessment process will include 3 rounds with the sponsor, a member of her team, and a stakeholder they will support.
Required Candidate Preparation: Candidates should have their prior related experience ready to discuss prior to the assessment.


Our team is looking for a detail-oriented and adaptable Data Analyst to support regulatory reporting and content moderation initiatives. This role is essential in helping the organization meet evolving global compliance requirements while ensuring accurate and independent data analysis and reporting safety data.

Job Responsibilities:


Gather, Collate, and Categorize safety-related data from various internal corporate data sources.
Analyze and Interpret data to support safety compliance guidance with international regulatory frameworks.
Interpret for regulatory ACP inquiries and reports (est. at least one per month by end of fiscal year)
Build and maintain queries to extract data for transparency and compliance reports.
Thoroughly understand the regulatory safety frameworks and collaborate with stakeholders to evolve reporting logic in near-real-time as regulations change.
Advise on reporting parameters and ensure alignment with legal and regulatory standards.
Identify and resolve discrepancies in data reporting across systems or platforms.
Ensure consistent and accurate data narratives that reflect the organization’s unique context.
Work cross-functionally with internal teams to support data infrastructure and reporting needs.
Represent the organization in meetings and contribute to documentation and process reviews.
Participate in regular check-ins and collaborate on onboarding and training initiatives.
Independently prioritize tasks, plan analyses, and deliver actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations clearly to technical and non-technical audiences.


Qualifications:

Education


Bachelors degree in technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
8+ years of applicable industry experience required.


Required Skills & Experience


3-5 years of experience with advanced SQL and Python scripting for building, optimizing, and maintaining complex queries.
3 years experience with tools like Power BI or Tableau to create compelling dashboards and reports.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools (e.g., Databricks, Apache Spark etc.,).
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis, automation, and scripting.
Experience with APIs and data pipelines for integrating and automating data flows.
Familiarity with Azure cloud-based data ecosystems (e.g., Azure Data Explorer, Cosmos, Azure Data Lake Storage).
Understanding of data warehousing and distributed computing concepts.
Desire to be working with data and help businesses make better data driven decisions.


Preferred Qualifications:


Excellent verbal, visual and written communication skills.
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Experience in data analysis, preferably in a regulatory or compliance setting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement abilities.
Self-starter with strong planning and prioritization skills.
Knowledge of global data privacy and safety regulations (e.g.,GDPR).
Experience working with compliance teams or legal frameworks is a plus.
Interest in games or experience in gaming industry is a plus.

HTML:
Job#: 2080519

Job Description:

Senior Data Analyst - Regulatory Reporting & Content Moderation

Onsite in Redmond, WA 3-4 days onsite/week.

Chance for Extension (Y/N): Highly Likely

This role is in terms of convenience and collaboration with team, partner with different teams and it would be significant for them to come in in-person. Nature of work is not something they should be isolated doing remotely; lots of partnership

Typical Day in the Role

Purpose of the Team: The purpose of this team is data analytics to gather insights and experiences team for the larger gaming team.

Key projects: This role will be a part of the team that supports safety and compliance regulatory systems. The role will work with the team on emerging regulatory requirements and gathering, processing data per regulations as regulations are updated. Some data that will be handled includes content moderation, player safety data, how the content moderation is working, safety classifications, some end user data, and more. The role will work with stakeholders to gather resources, and build reports for the team. The role will write SQL queries and use various tools including apache spark platform to own end-to-end delivery and tell stories using data. The role will also support infrastructure and collaboration, working with player safety team and collaborating with them and upstream partners to set up processes and collect data points to build dashboards and reports. The role will manage queries independently, advise others on parameters, partner with other internal teams to build a data story around content moderation. The role will also communicate the data story and present this in meetings to stakeholders, and review documentation and advise next steps to stakeholders as well.

Typical task breakdown and operating rhythm: The role will consist of a check in/stand up meeting every day, and various meetings with stakeholders or upstream partners occasionally. The role will be around 20% meetings, 20% data analysis, 50% building code/reports/dashboards, 10% presenting to stakeholders.

Compelling Story & Candidate Value Proposition

What makes this role interesting? - This role provides the opportunity to work on a large gaming team and do the hard work that keeps a gaming studio successful.

Candidate Requirements

  • Years of Experience Required: 8 overall years of experience in the field.
  • Degrees or certifications required: A Bachelor’s degree in a related field is required to be eligible for this role.
  • Disqualifiers: Candidates that are not strong presenters or do not have the required skills will not be eligible for the role.
  • Best vs. Average: The ideal resume would contain a technical background and a strong background in regulation and moderation. Previous experience in the gaming industry is nice to see. The ideal candidate is a self starter and excels at taking on tasks and driving completion themselves without micromanagement. Previous experience working with partners and stakeholders, strong data analysis, and experience with platforms like Databricks, Apache Spark, etc. is very helpful.
  • Performance Indicators: Performance will be assessed based on quality of data gathered and ability to support the team.

Top 3 Hard Skills Required + Years of Experience

  • Minimum 5 years experience with advanced SQL and Python scripting to build and optimize complex queries, preferably with platforms like Databricks, Apache Spark, etc.
  • Minimum 5 years experience with PowerBI producing dashboards and reports
  • Minimum 5 years experience with cross functional teams to gather data, then reporting on and presenting data insights to stakeholders.

Hard Skills Assessments

  • Expected Dates that Hard Skills Assessments will be scheduled: Week of July 22nd and afterwards
  • Hard Skills Assessment Process: The assessment process will include 3 rounds with the sponsor, a member of her team, and a stakeholder they will support.
  • Required Candidate Preparation: Candidates should have their prior related experience ready to discuss prior to the assessment.

Title: Manager, Price Intelligence
Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Seramount, Fair360 and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Intelligence to join our Growth and Strategy organization.

Responsibilities:


Lead the enhancement and automation of pricing reports and dashboards to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort; leverage SQL to optimize data architecture and use Python or R to automate workflows and ETL processes; ensure reporting aligns with strategic goals, and support scalable insight delivery
Drive the team's use of business intelligence tools to elevate analytics maturity; identify and implement improvements in data visualization, reporting, and insight generation; collaborate cross-functionally to ensure BI solutions meet evolving business needs, and support decision-making
Investigate current data sources to assess quality, relevance, and potential alternatives; curate and validate data for accuracy and readiness for advanced analytics; lead Quality Assurance (QA) processes, and ensure data integrity across key projects, including two major system migrations
Streamline reporting processes, identifying automation opportunities, and delivering insights that drive pricing strategy
Own the data curation for the Pricing and Commercial Enablement's Data and Analytics team
Design and implement scalable data solutions to support advanced analytics and decision-making


Qualifications:


Minimum five years of recent experience in data analytics and visualization; pricing or professional services experience is preferred
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; Master's from an accredited college or university is preferred
Strong background in data-driven decision-making, process optimization, and business intelligence
Advanced SQL skills, including database architecture and stores procedures; proficiency in programming language such as Python or R; Power BI experience preferred; familiarity with Azure Data Lake and Databricks
Ability to build relationships and influence across matrixed teams
Strategic thinker with strong analytical, and project management skills
Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for employment-based visa sponsorship now or in the future. KPMG LLP will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work visa status for this opportunity (no sponsorship is available for H-1B, L-1, TN, O-1, E-3, H-1B1, F-1, J-1, OPT, CPT or any other employment-based visa)


KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”.

Title: L&I Data Analyst (Data Consultant 4)
Company: Washington State Department of Labor & Industries
Description:
Description

Our Mission: Keep Washington Safe and Working!

Our Values: Customer Focus, One L&I, Respect, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Learning and Growth, Reliability

Job Highlights

Please Note: This opportunity is open to current L&I employees only.

Make a difference in L&I’s Data Analysis by performing the design, development, and implementation of reporting solutions that promote the agency's strategic and tactical direction and business process improvements. In this role, you’ll participate in building the foundation for tracking agency business processes and program metrics, and encourages the use of data for making decisions. You’ll work closely with agency executive management and primarily support the Health Services Analysis and Office of the Medical Director programs of the Insurance Services division.

Duties

Some Of What You’ll Do


Elicit, clarify and refine data and business reporting requirements from customers, including interpreting customer needs or situation to design data solutions and innovative and effective approaches to solve analytic problems
Develop model of final output, verifying availability and validity of data required to produce the desired result
Write code using tools such as Hyperion Studio, SAS (Statistical Analysis System), SSMS (SQL Server Management Studio), SSRS (SQL Server Reporting System), and languages including SQL (Structured Query Language) and JavaScript. Extract, analyze, manipulate and format data from the agency’s data warehouse and integrate with other data sources.
Evaluate results to verify accuracy and usability of data to fulfill the intent of the request. Determine appropriate method to remove, amend, exclude data, or revise coding logic and implement as necessary.
Create and distribute highly complex statistical reports, which may be a multi-paged Excel document, including datasets, charts and graphs, a Word document, Power Point presentation, or a web based interactive report (Business Intelligence Center).
Advises project teams so that accurate, intelligible data is available in easily interpreted forms to support decision making.


Qualifications

Required:

A Bachelor's degree including college level coursework in Statistics and/or Mathematics

AND

Three years of experience working as a Data Consultant 3 or equivalent. Graduate training in related discipline may be substituted for up to two years of experience.

OR

Equivalent education/experience.

Desired


Three years’ experience within the Health Services Analysis program of Labor and Industries as a Medical Treatment Adjudicator.
One years’ experience with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Excel.
Intermediate Hyperion Reporting Studio, SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SAS (Statistical Analysis System), SharePoint and Excel skills
Intermediate JavaScript skills
Knowledge of Kimball Data Warehouse design
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Supplemental Information

Things You Need To Know

To help you maintain a proper work-life balance, teleworking is one of the work schedule options for this position. L&I also offers flexible custom work schedules.

State employees who meet the qualifications will become eligible for a generous retirement package at the end of the employee’s career. Click on the “Benefits” tab to learn more.

At L&I, your voice matters. In addition, L&I is a diverse state agency dedicated to the safety and health and security of Washington's 3.3 million workers. Take a look at this brief video and learn more about why L&I is an employer of choice.

For this position, telework is permitted full time. The assigned duty station for this position is Tumwater, Washington.

For positions where in-office work is necessary, the frequency of telework will be discussed with the supervisor of the position at the time of offer.

To receive more information on opportunities at L&I sign up for GovDelivery and select L&I job alerts.

Application process

We will contact the top candidates directly to interview for this position. Because we base the selection on information provided by you, it is in your best interest to identify the knowledge, skills, and abilities that address the required and desirable qualifications described in the announcement.

Please Include The Following Documents With Your Application


A cover letter describing specific qualifications.
A current resume detailing applicable experience and education.
A list of at least three professional references with current telephone numbers.


Please do not attach or place any medical information (vaccination status included) within the application, resume, or cover letter. If you do, we will have to reject your application to safeguard others from receiving your confidential information. You will have to remove the confidential information before you can apply again.

To learn more about our hiring process timeline at L&I please visit our L&I recruiting page at Hiring Process at L&I . If you would like to read our website in a language other than English, scroll up to the top of the page to select your language of choice from the banner.

Background Check Notice

Prior to a placement in this position, a background check, including criminal history record will be conducted. Information from your background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining your eligibility to perform the requirements of the position.

Other Information

For positions requiring travel, you must have a valid unrestricted driver's license and have insurance if driving a privately owned vehicle on state business.


This position is represented bytheWashington Federation of State Employees (WFSE).

The Department of Labor & Industries complies with the employment eligibility verification requirements of the federal employment eligibility verification form, I-9. The selected candidate must be able to provide proof of identity and eligibility to work in the United States consistent with the requirements of that form on the first day of employment.
Please note: L&I may use this announcement to fill multiple permanent and/or non-permanent positions.


Did You Know?

Washington is America's Top State to live, play, and work, according to U.S. News (2021). Join the L&I team and enjoy all the Evergreen State has to offer.

Applicants wishing to claim Veterans Preference should attach to their application a copy of their DD-214 (Member 4 copy), NGB 22, or signed verification of service letter from the United States Department of Veterans Affairs. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Employer

L&I employees come from all walks of life. We strive to hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds. Duties

Title: Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supervising a team of intelligence analysts in the development and production of intelligence-driven support products that assess risks, analyzes data / information to mitigate vulnerabilities to the client’s assets, operations, strategy, and brand reputation. The SIA must possess strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to quality check and write analytical reports and studies as required by the supervisory chain. Additionally, the SIA must have experience supervising others and collaborating in a team environment. The SIA should have a passion for leading and managing others, conducting analysis, problem-solving, and advising decision-makers. This is a multi-functional role that collaborates closely with numerous internal and external stakeholders/partners. The SIA must be able to maintain a positive attitude and articulate their thoughts in a clear, concise, and respectable manner during normal day-to-day business operations and times of increased frustration and stress. Additionally, a SIA must be able to develop others, set objectives, and manage a team towards their completion. They must be able to take direction without question and offer constructive feedback when applicable.

Pay Transparancy/ Compensation

$130,000 Per Year

Responsibilities


Manage team of analysts providing intelligence support to client on relevant emerging threats and early warning indicators.
Ensure team maintains detailed situational awareness of external events, including crime, weather, health, sociopolitical, geopolitical, and other issues that may threaten or impact the client.
Enable team to provide timely and effective support to requests for intelligence and ad-hoc client requests.
Collaborate with team to develop analysis and deliver assessments to client.
Oversee the development and production of intelligence-driven products that assess threats and analyze information to mitigate threats to the client, assets, operations, strategy, and brand reputation.
Supervise tactical and strategic level intelligence support for travel risk management, regional security operations, event security, and executive protection.
Prepare and present intelligence briefings to client leadership and targeted audiences; coordinate with team on the development of briefing skills and presentation abilities.
Maintain team proficiency with social media platforms, search tools, productivity applications, communication technology, and open-source intelligence (OSINT) resources (LexisNexis, etc).
Plan and implement intelligence reporting processes while adapting to evolving situations and client demands; assign reporting responsibilities to team.
Ensure coordination and communication with various stakeholders regarding intelligence requirements.
Train, mentor, and supervise assigned intelligence analysts in support of the intelligence program.
Safeguard highly sensitive and confidential client information.
Complete multiple tasks simultaneously and function in a fast-paced, evolving environment with minimal supervision


Qualifications


College Degree or equivalent in any relevant field such as security studies, law enforcement, intelligence, political science, international affairs.
8+ years of relevant work experience in intelligence or in related (to include academic) fields.
2+ years of relevant work experience in a supervisory role leading and managing others.
Proven ability to work with highly confidential information.
Demonstrated ability to supervise others in a fast-paced and high stress environment.
Demonstrated ability to complete multiple tasks simultaneously and function in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
Strong analytic, oral, and written presentation skills to include the ability to deliver communications centered on the target audience.
Advanced proficiency in, or the aptitude and willingness to rapidly learn, Web-based social media platforms, search tools, productivity applications, and communication technology.
Ability to teach and develop others on analytical tradecraft and intelligence platforms.
Must have a high degree of emotional intelligence and maturity.
Proficiency in MS Office applications.
Must have familiarity with data visualization tools (to include building infographics).
Must be willing to be on-call during weeknights and weekends.
Must have a valid driver’s license.


Preferred Qualifications


Military or Law Enforcement Intelligence Analyst experience.
Leadership and management skills.
Strong communication and writing skills.
Advanced proficiency in, or the aptitude and willingness to rapidly learn, Web-based social media platforms, search tools, productivity applications, and communication technology, the ability to utilize all available OSINT resources.
A life-long learner; someone who is dedicated to developing as an intelligence professional is also a must.
Know and understand the intelligence cycle.


Benefits

Constellis offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflect its commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.


Medical, Vision & Dental Insurance
Paid Time-Off Program & Company Paid Holidays
401(k) Retirement Plan
Insurance: Basic Life & Supplemental Life
Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Personal Development & Learning Opportunities
On-the-job Training, Skills Development & Certifications
Employee Referral Program
Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach


Physical Requirements

Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Must have close visual and audio acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; determining the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of work; or to make general observations of facilities or structures. Must meet all physical and psychological standards as required by the contract. Local travel or participation in shift work may be requested. Must be able to enter, exit, and operate a vehicle safely.

Title: ML Data Associate-II, Artificial General Intelligence
Description:
Description

AI is the most transformational technology of our time, capable of tackling some of humanity’s most challenging problems. Amazon is investing in generative AI and the responsible development and deployment of large language models (LLMs) across all of our businesses. Come build the future of human-technology interaction with us!

We are looking for candidates who just don’t think outside the box, but make the box "bigger".

The future is now. Do you want to be a part of it? Then read on!

Key job responsibilities


Maintain and follow strict confidentiality guidelines as customer privacy is our top priority
Work with a wide range of different types of data including but not limited to text, speech, image, and video
Deliver high-quality labelled data, utilizing in-house tools, software, and guidelines to meet our Key Performance Indicators
Serve as a subject matter expert for Machine Learning (ML) data workflows.
Demonstrate proficiency in research, ranking responses based on factual and grammatical accuracy, and creating grammatically correct text, speech, image, and video annotation
Capable of making sound judgments and logical decisions when faced with ambiguous or incomplete information while performing tasks.
Rapidly switch from one category of work to another all while maintaining attention to detail
Demonstrate expertise in handling end-to-end data execution processes related to LLM labelling tasks
Analyze root causes, identify error patterns, and propose solutions to enhance the quality of labeling tasks and their outputs
Identify and escalate operational issues within day-to-day process, standard operating procedures and tools.
Suggest ways to invent and simplify and/or unblock operational workflows


A day in the life

We are looking for a ML Data Associate (MLDA) to undertake the task of foundational labeling functions, such as dialogue evaluation on speech, text, audio, video data.

Your ability to concentrate, multi-task and your high attention to detail helps you deliver high-quality work as well as maintaining strict confidentiality and follow all applicable Amazon policies for securing confidential information. You will be a part of a diverse team with the shared vision of improving customers’ lives with practical, useful generative AI innovations. An inner drive, individuality, and a creative mind are extremely beneficial.

Basic Qualifications


An Associate’s Degree or related work experience
C1+ or equivalent fluency in English language
Strong business writing skills with ability to create reports, proposals, and professional correspondence
Advanced reading comprehension with ability to analyze complex business documents
Developed analytical thinking and structured problem-solving capabilities
Strong ability to interpret and implement detailed instructions across various projects
Proficient research skills with experience gathering and synthesizing information from multiple sources
Proven attention to detail in managing complex tasks and documents
Experience managing stakeholder relationships across departments
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and common business applications.


Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
2+ years of professional work experience with demonstrated task execution ability
Proven capacity to leverage open-source resources effectively for comprehensive research purposes
Ability to adapt well to fast-paced environments with changing circumstances, direction, and strategy


Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $43,680/year in our lowest geographic market up to $47,840/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
