Title: Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
As an NRG employee, we encourage you to take charge of your career and development journey. We invite you to explore exciting opportunities across our businesses. You’ll find that our dynamic work environment provides variety and challenge. Your growth is key to our ongoing success—take the lead in shaping your career development, goals and future!

Job Summary

NRG Home East Region is seeking an energetic and ambitious individual to support our Offer Pricing and Revenue Management team. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills with the ability to execute several different duties while maintaining the same commitment to quality and detail. This position will provide support primarily in terms of reporting, data analysis, and research but candidate should be prepared to expand their duties to meet shifting priorities within the organization.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities


Independently prepare monthly, weekly, and ad hoc reports as necessary including key business metrics reports, performance reports, and dashboards with consistency and accuracy.
Perform analysis of data and form conclusions/recommendations based on findings.
Research ad hoc requests.
Perform other duties as assigned.


Working Conditions


100% Remote – must be Eastern or Central time zone.
Some overtime required as special projects arise.
Minimal travel.


Minimum Requirements


BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business related field.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, with advanced knowledge in Excel.
Demonstrates a commitment to quality and strong attention to detail.
Exhibits strong analytical, reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Highly organized with strong oral and written communication skills.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with SQL highly preferred.
Experience in energy-related field a plus but not necessary.


Additional Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Comfortable with ambiguity; ability to work with incomplete data or on seemingly open-ended questions and translate into actionable analysis.
Proactive self-starter.
Proficient at working in a fast-paced, matrixed environment.
Ability to work across a large, complex organization in a way that fosters collaboration.
Able to handle multiple priority tasks and meet short deadlines with minimal supervision.


Physical Requirements


None.


Why NRG Is a Great Place To Work


Great company culture!! Voted as a BEST employer by Forbes
A competitive total compensation package, including annual incentive and/or commission
Stock Purchase Plan
Benefits on the first day of employment - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, and Short-Term Disability, Wellness program, etc.
Company-paid life insurance and disability insurance
401 (k) plan to help save for retirement
Generous FTO (Flexible Time Off) plan, plus 8 company holidays.
Numerous discounts, including electricity discounts on NRG brands


NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability. Level, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.

Official description on file with Talent.

Title: Asset Data
Description:
Closing Date

2025-09-15

Job Title: Asset Data Specialist

Location: Hybrid working between our Falmer office and home

Contract Type: Permanent

Hours: 37 hours per week, Monday - Friday

Salary: Salary depending on skills and experience.

Southern Water is entering a truly exciting chapter – with the launch of AMP8, we're gearing up for transformational change and ambitious growth.

We’ve already welcomed one fantastic new team member, and now we’re looking for another talented individual to join us in a newly created role within our expanding team. This is a unique opportunity to be part of something fresh, forward-thinking, and full of potential – right from the start.

If you’re ready to make an impact and grow with a business that’s investing in the future, we’d love to hear from you.

Job Overview

The Asset Data Specialist will play a critical role in developing, maintaining, and analysing asset data within Southern Water’s systems, ensuring compliance with asset data governance standards while maintaining accuracy and integrity. This role will focus on leveraging data analytics, automation, and reporting tools to monitor data quality, identify trends, and drive actionable insights for continuous improvement.

About You

We are keen to hear from candidates with experience in in statistical analysis, data quality and confidence measurement. You’ll enjoy working with complex data sets but be able to effectively summarise for stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be experienced in implementing asset management planning and analysis processes, and able to use Enterprise Asset Management Systems.

Responsibilities Will Include

55%


Collection, validation and Maintenance of asset data in Southern Water asset data systems, ensuring consistency across all platforms.
Reporting on asset data health and progress being made to improve data completeness and accuracy, analysing data trends and providing insight for decision making.
Data cleansing, processing and verification on any new or updated asset data.


25%


Maintaining asset data change management processes and monitor the effectiveness of Data Governance practices and adjusting these to remedy any issues.


20%


Accountable for delivering awareness sessions to the business to ensure that asset data management is understood, asset and system data is valued by the business and to drive the right behaviours towards safeguarding data quality.
Accountable for updating all processes to incorporate best-practice where applicable, to adjust for new types and sources of data and for responding to the impact of innovation in the business.
Responsible for promoting Systems Thinking in relation to the governance of asset and system data.


Package

This role will be full time Monday to Friday with a hybrid approach to working between our office in Falmer (Brighton) 2-3 days per week, and working from home.

We are offering a salary depending on skills and experience as well as other benefits including:


Company and performance-related bonus
Generous pension with up to 11% company contribution
Life assurance payment equal to four times your annual salary
Health benefits through a Cash Plan
Two paid community volunteering days a year
25 days annual holiday
Occupational health service
Perkbox benefits offering discounts and savings on several products and experiences
Study support may be available for job-related qualifications
We offer competitive maternity leave and flexible return to work options


Does this opportunity excite you but you’re not 100% sure if you meet all the requirements for the role? Or are you concerned that ‘normal’ office hours aren’t possible given your personal circumstances? Whilst we can’t accommodate every flexible working request, we’ll try to find a practical solution. So why not engage with us and find out more about this role?

Our customers are at the heart of everything we do, because delivering water for life is our core purpose. To achieve this, we need 24/7 support in place to resolve incidents quickly and efficiently. All our employees understand the importance of out-of-hours incident support – because when problems appear, fixing them is our top priority. That’s why our people join together and support when and however needed to make sure our customers get the service they deserve. During your interview, your manager will speak to you about any incident support rotas that apply to your position.

Privacy Statement

Please note: If you are an existing Southern Water employee, you will need to confirm within your application that your Manager is aware of your application.

All applicants must be eligible to live and work in the UK. You will need to provide evidence of eligibility (e.g. a passport or long birth certificate and proof of NI) and current proof of address (dated within the last 3 months), will be required as part of the recruitment process. If you do not meet these criteria, your application will not be considered.

Title: Bi-weekly Cleaner in Hove Wanted
Description:
We require reliable hard-working cleaners in Hove and nearby areas.

You will be paid £12.50 p/h and will be expected to work to a high standard with cash paid at the end of each clean.

Working on a self-employment basis you will be able to confirm your own hours with our clients and this will allow you to build up a flexible schedule.

All of our work is in a clients own home, normally during the day weekdays and it helps if you drive, but not essential.

Salary: £12.50 - £15

Title: Creative Coordinator
Description:
Job Title: Creative Coordinator

Location: Brighton Office

Reports to: Head of Creative & Content

Department: Creative

About the Role:

We’re on the lookout for a super-organised, people-savvy Creative Coordinator to join our creative team. You’ll be the go-to person for making sure everything flows smoothly - from the first brief to the final deliverable.

In this role, you’ll be right at the heart of it all: keeping projects on track, making sure our designers and copywriters know exactly what they’re working on, and bringing all the right people (and info!) together at the right time. You’ll work closely with teams across the business and support the Head of Creative & Content in keeping everything ticking along.

If you’re a natural organiser with a love for creativity, teamwork and a good to-do list, we’d love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:


Manage the day-to-day flow of incoming and outgoing creative briefs across the team.
Gather and clarify project details (timings, objectives, assets) by liaising with stakeholders across the business.
Brief the design and copywriting teams clearly and efficiently (with oversight from Head of Creative) ensuring creative output aligns with project goals.
Track the progress of creative projects and ensure deadlines are met.
Report to and support the Head of Creative & Content with day-to-day admin, project tracking, and team coordination.
Assist the Head of Creative and Retail Team in preparing and sending POS materials to print for our store network.
Provide occasional support to the Creative Production Team (e.g. assisting with production liaison between production team and creative team).
Maintain and update project management tools and calendars.
Support the Head of Creative in budget management, ensuring the whole team is tracking budgets efficiently.
Maintain records of freelancers we regularly work with, being the main point of contact for contracting them when projects arise.


What We’re Looking For:


Experience in a creative or marketing project coordination/management role (preferably agency).
Experience managing campaigns from inception through to production and delivery.
Strong organisational and time-management skills, with an eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills - you’ll be talking to multiple teams across the business.
Confidence in briefing creative teams and understanding the needs of design and copy.
A proactive mindset and the ability to solve problems before they become blockers.
Comfortable juggling multiple projects at once and working in a fast-paced environment.
A passion for creativity and a team-first attitude.


The Details


This is a full-time role, with four days a week in our Brighton office
You'll be working from an office with possibly the best sea view in Brighton.
Salary: £28,000 per year
Plus: the chance to be part of a brilliant, kind, and creative team doing meaningful, purpose-driven work.
Show more

Job Title: Creative Coordinator

Location: Brighton Office

Reports to: Head of Creative & Content

Department: Creative

About the Role:

We’re on the lookout for a super-organised, people-savvy Creative Coordinator to join our creative team. You’ll be the go-to person for making sure everything flows smoothly - from the first brief to the final deliverable.

In this role, you’ll be right at the heart of it all: keeping projects on track, making sure our designers and copywriters know exactly what they’re working on, and bringing all the right people (and info!) together at the right time. You’ll work closely with teams across the business and support the Head of Creative & Content in keeping everything ticking along.

If you’re a natural organiser with a love for creativity, teamwork and a good to-do list, we’d love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage the day-to-day flow of incoming and outgoing creative briefs across the team.
  • Gather and clarify project details (timings, objectives, assets) by liaising with stakeholders across the business.
  • Brief the design and copywriting teams clearly and efficiently (with oversight from Head of Creative) ensuring creative output aligns with project goals.
  • Track the progress of creative projects and ensure deadlines are met.
  • Report to and support the Head of Creative & Content with day-to-day admin, project tracking, and team coordination.
  • Assist the Head of Creative and Retail Team in preparing and sending POS materials to print for our store network.
  • Provide occasional support to the Creative Production Team (e.g. assisting with production liaison between production team and creative team).
  • Maintain and update project management tools and calendars.
  • Support the Head of Creative in budget management, ensuring the whole team is tracking budgets efficiently.
  • Maintain records of freelancers we regularly work with, being the main point of contact for contracting them when projects arise.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Experience in a creative or marketing project coordination/management role (preferably agency).
  • Experience managing campaigns from inception through to production and delivery.
  • Strong organisational and time-management skills, with an eye for detail.
  • Excellent communication skills - you’ll be talking to multiple teams across the business.
  • Confidence in briefing creative teams and understanding the needs of design and copy.
  • A proactive mindset and the ability to solve problems before they become blockers.
  • Comfortable juggling multiple projects at once and working in a fast-paced environment.
  • A passion for creativity and a team-first attitude.

The Details

  • This is a full-time role, with four days a week in our Brighton office
  • You'll be working from an office with possibly the best sea view in Brighton.
  • Salary: £28,000 per year
  • Plus: the chance to be part of a brilliant, kind, and creative team doing meaningful, purpose-driven work.

Title: Work from home as a GCSE tutor - Part Time, Flexible Schedule
Description:
Passionate about education and skilled in GCSE subjects? Join us as a Work-From-Home GCSE Tutor at FindTutors! We're seeking a dedicated individual to provide personalized and comprehensive tutoring to GCSE-level students in a remote setting. As a Work-From-Home GCSE Tutor, you'll guide students through various subjects, offering support, clarification, and exam preparation. This remote opportunity allows you to work from the comfort of your home while making a meaningful impact on students' academic success.

REQUIREMENTS:


No previous experience required.
Basic knowledge of the subject taught.


ADVANTAGES


Flexible schedule
Work anywhere in the UK
Possibility of working online
Get paid between £20 and £40 /hour.

Title: Biology Technician
Description:
Job Overview

Required as soon as possible

Biology Technician

At Roedean, we are dedicated to providing a world-class education that inspires and empowers girls aged 11-18 to achieve their full potential. Our stunning cliff-top location overlooking the sea, combined with our rich heritage and commitment to academic excellence, makes Roedean a truly unique and inspiring place to learn and work. We are proud of our inclusive and supportive community where every student is encouraged to pursue their passions and develop the skills they need for future success.

The Biology Technician will coordinate the use of practical resources and facilities and provide assistance and advice in meeting the practical needs of the Science curriculum. The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of Biology. Science is a thriving department where Biology is taught to A-level. The ability to support the Chemistry and Physics Departments would be an advantage.

We welcome your interest in being part of our journey at a time of continued development

Roedean is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the post, including checks with past employers and the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS).

The post is exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974. The School is therefore permitted to ask job applicants to declare all convictions and cautions on a self-declaration form in advance of attending an interview (including those which are "spent" unless they are "protected" under the DBS filtering rules) in order to assess their suitability to work with children.

Please download an application pack from our website (www.roedean.co.uk/Vacancies) or contact Louisa Butler via vacancies@roedean.co.uk. Please note we do not accept CVs.

Closing date: 9am, 26 August 2025.

Due to the need to appoint quickly we reserve the right to interview and appoint at any time.
Show more

Title: Project Support Coordinator
Description:
Location: Crawley | Office-Based | Monday to Friday, 7:30am-4:30pm

Salary: £27,000 - £35,000 + Company Bonus Scheme

Benefits: Team-Centric Culture, Growth Opportunities

Are you organised, proactive, and keen to make your mark on high-end design and construction projects?

This is your chance to join a dynamic, design-led business working at the top end of the architectural interiors market. From luxury residences in Mayfair to landmark hotels, you'll be at the heart of projects where precision, creativity, and customer experience are everything.

As a Project Support Coordinator, you'll play a key role in managing technical quotes, liaising with internal and external teams, and ensuring that complex projects run smoothly from enquiry to delivery. It's a varied role, ideal for someone detail-oriented and naturally collaborative, with room to learn, grow, and shape their own career path.

What You'll Be Doing:


Assist with project scheduling, approval, production and overall project timelines
Coordinate logistics for deliveries and site requirements
Support the smooth delivery of projects by tracking progress and ensuring milestones are met communicating effectively with the client, suppliers and internal teams
Provide administrative support: raise orders, update quotes, track progress, raise purchase orders and prepare proforma invoices
Organise and attend project meetings, take minutes, and follow up on action items
Maintain accurate and organised project documentation and filing systems
Help with procurement tasks such as raising purchase and production orders
Keep CRM/ERP systems updated with current project and customer data
Communicate with the drawing team to request the creation and revision of technical drawings and documentation
Capture customer requirements, ensuring alignment with internal processes and product certifications
Act as a key point of contact for clients and suppliers, delivering clear and timely updates
Ensure a strong focus on logistics coordination, timely delivery, and client satisfaction.


Requirements

What You'll Need:


Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
A methodical, calm and detail-oriented approach
Confidence working across technical drawings, schedules, and pricing systems (full training provided)
IT proficiency (Outlook, CRM systems, Microsoft Office)
A collaborative mindset, someone who thrives in a team environment
Desire to grow with the company and develop your technical knowledge


This would suit someone with experience in estimating, technical administration, project support, or even a recent graduate in construction, architecture or engineering looking to build their career.

Why Apply?


Unique exposure to prime and super-prime projects across central London
Fast-track development potential in a growing business
A flat, supportive structure with no micromanagement
A company that believes in doing things properly, from process to product


Apply now if you're ready to be part of a team delivering excellence from the ground up. Full training provided... attitude and attention to detail are what matter most!
Show more

Title: Horsham: Care Assistant Horsham
Description:
Care Assistant Horsham

< Back to Jobs Listings

Location: Horsham

Salary: £13.25 - £19.00 per hour

Hours: 28-30 hours a week

We’re hiring Care Assistants in the Horsham area!

Are you kind, reliable, and ready to make a real difference in your community? If so, we’d love to hear from you.

We Currently Have 4 Available Rotas

Rota 1 – Monday to Friday: 17:00 to 22:00 and Saturday 07:00 – 12:00

Rota 2 – Saturday & Sunday: 08:00 – 22:00

Rota 3 – Monday & Tuesday: 07:00 to 22:00

Rota 4 (Available from September 2025) Monday to Friday: 07:00 to 15:30 & Alternate Saturdays: 07:00 to 22:00

⭐What’s in it for You?


✅ Competitive Pay Rates:
Monday to Friday (9:00 – 18:00): £13.25 per hour
Monday to Friday Early & Late Hours (07:00 – 09:00 & 18:00 – 22:00): £13.50 per hour
Weekends (07:00 – 22:00): £14.75 per hour
Bank Holidays (07:00 – 22:00): £19.00 per hour
Paid mileage at 30p per mile.


✅ Additional Perks & Benefits


£200 Refer-a-Friend Bonus
£150 Signing-On Bonus
Fully funded Diploma in Health & Social Care
E-skutas available for non-drivers to use for work


What You Will Be Doing

As a Care Assistant, you will deliver high-quality care and support to individuals living in their own homes. Your responsibilities will include:

✔ Personal care

✔ Meal preparation

✔ Medication support

✔ Companionship (may also involve personal care)

You’ll share with other staff in meeting the personal care and support needs of customers in a way that respects the dignity of the individual and promotes their independence. The care and support provided by Care and Support Workers is expected to include support that would reasonably be given by members of the client’s family and is not to include tasks that would normally be undertaken by a trained nurse.

Full Training Provided ✅

What You Need


Full UK driving licence & your own car (or willingness to use an e-skuta)
A caring nature & desire to help others


Being a carer isn’t always easy, but it’s one of the most rewarding jobs you’ll ever do!

We’re excited to hear from you – apply today!

For more information about our community and updates, please visit our news page.

For additional resources on working in care, you can visit:


Skills for Care – Comprehensive guidance on training and qualifications in the care sector.
Care Quality Commission (CQC) – The regulator of health and social care in England, providing information on care standards.


🏷️INDPULCA

Apply for this position

Please complete the form below and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Where did you hear about us?*

Upload CV (optional) 3mb max

We’re excited to hear from you – apply today!

For more information about our community and updates, please visit our news page.

For additional resources on working in care, you can visit:

  • Skills for Care – Comprehensive guidance on training and qualifications in the care sector.
  • Care Quality Commission (CQC) – The regulator of health and social care in England, providing information on care standards.

Title: BI Developer
Description:
Business Intelligence Developer – Nationwide Company - Up to 50K plus bens (Hybrid and/or fully remote options available) – West Sussex or UK based (fully remote)

Stratospherec have a wonderful job opportunity for a talented BI Developer to join the team at our client who are a nationwide company who provide Family centred services across the UK. This is a truly unique opportunity for an ambitious BI developer/ Power BI developer to use your expertise and insight to positively improve the outcomes for young people and their families. This role offers significant progression and exposure to the latest technologies for an ambitious Business Intelligence Developer who is seeking a long-term role collaborating alongside a talented team of developers and business analysts.

In this BI developer role you will be responsible for developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI, transforming raw data from both multiple data sources and data warehouse into actionable insights to support business decision-making. This will necessitate you working closely with, and supporting colleagues from across the business and the wider IT team, to ensure requirements are met and service delivery is maintained to a high standard.

This is a brilliant role for an ambitious Business Intelligence Developer to use their expertise to quite literally change people’s lives, whilst working for a talented, collaborative, and exceedingly well supported team, designing, specifying and building software and backend solutions which integrate with or complement our clients business system applications.

The company place great emphasis on professional development and offer an attractive benefits package as well as plenty of opportunities to get involved in charity days and teambuilding.

Key Responsibilities


Designing, developing, and maintaining Power BI dashboards, reports, and data visualizations.
Collaboration with stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business Intelligence reporting models.
Optimizing data models for performance and scalability in Power BI.
Producing accurate estimates for change requests and project deliverables.
Participating in Daily Stand ups and other Scrum ceremonies as required.
Creating solid, scalable, maintainable, and testable solutions.
Creating and managing DAX queries, calculated columns, and measures.
Integrating Power BI reports with other applications using embedded analytics and APIs where necessary.
Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across reporting tools.
Providing training and documentation for end-users and team members.
Monitoring BI solutions to ensure performance and availability.
Providing third line support to the Service Desk, as necessary.


Key Skills


Proven experience with Power BI in a commercial setting
Strong DAX, Power Query, and data modelling capabilities
A solid understanding of relational databases, especially Microsoft Azure SQL Server
Knowledge of data modelling, architecture, and reporting design
An understanding of application security layer models in Power BI
Expert in MS SQL Server and database tools and proficiency working with relational databases
Understanding of data warehousing, ETL processes, and data modelling (star/snowflake schema).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
An understanding of Power BI version control and integration with PowerBI Reporting.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
Familiarity with data governance, privacy regulations, and compliance practices
Strong communication skills and stakeholder management skills


Experience


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Statistics, or related field or demonstrable experience is desirable.
3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, data analytics, or a related field.
Demonstrable experience with Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and Power BI Service.
Experience with some or all of the following would be advantageous Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Platform tools, Data Warehouses, Data Lakes and Databricks.


Salary And Benefits

This BI developer role is offering a competitive salary up to 50K, Pension Scheme, Group Life Assurance Scheme, 25 days holiday and increased holiday entitlement subject to long service, enhanced maternity/paternity pay scheme, access to Perks for Work scheme.

If this BI Developer opportunity looks to be of interest then please reach out as soon as possible to find out more
Show more

Title: Implementation Specialist
Description:
Overview

This position is responsible for the initial software set-up of new clients, client properties, and client property vendors. The position also assists with the daily processing of customer invoices.  Applicant should be well-versed in the multifamily industry, have exceptional customer service and organizational skills, as well as above average computer skills.

Responsibilities


Setup of Clients, Property sites, and Vendors for Invoice Processing
Maintain and update Vendor accounts as needed.
Provide guidance to client through the implementation process.
Generate daily reports of received and outstanding property invoices.
Research and resolve client questions, issues and problems.
Review data inputs for accuracy/completeness.
Assist with preparation and scanning of invoices.
Assist with keying invoices into invoice processing application (VES).


Qualifications


Ability to learn and utilize new procedures and processes quickly.
Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word and Internet Explorer; testing may be requested.
Experience in fast paced, production environment.
High level of organizational skills.
Detail oriented.
Ability to multitask.
Ability and desire to work within a team environment.
Able to quickly analyze and troubleshoot problem issues.
High School diploma or equivalent is required; Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.
Multifamily experience or property management experience is preferred.
10-Key desirable.
Professional demeanor.
Able to sit or stand for frequent periods in the same location with some opportunity to move about.
Able to stoop or lift light material (typically less than 8 pounds).
Overtime may be required to meet department deadlines.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Data Analyst I
Description:
Location: Boston, Seaport

Employment Type: 6 Month Contract

Are you a data-driven problem solver with a knack for financial modeling and capacity planning? Join our team as a Data Analyst I and help shape strategic decisions with your analytical expertise.

🔍 What You’ll Do


Analyze financial, economic, and market data to support decision-making.
Support capacity planning, budgeting, and reporting for operating expenses, capital investments, and resource allocation.
Build and manage financial models to forecast business performance and conduct variance analysis.
Collaborate on the design and implementation of tools/systems to support evolving business needs.


🎓 What You Bring:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or related field. MBA or similar graduate degree preferred.
0–3 years of relevant experience, ideally with exposure to capacity planning or operations.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop complex financial models.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; SQL knowledge is a strong plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented, adaptable, and able to work independently in a dynamic environment.


ES2

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000
Show more

Who You Are:

  • Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
  • Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
  • Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client in need of a Data Analyst in Boston, MA. Responsibilities:


Support ETL operations to transfer data from legacy HR systems into Workday, ensuring high quality and integrity across all datasets
Collaborate with functional and technical teams to gather and define data migration requirements using Workday Data Gathering Workbooks
Design and execute EIB templates for automated data loads and transformations within Workday
Cleanse, normalize, and validate data for compatibility with Workday's data structure and business rules
Provide insights and actionable recommendations based on data analysis to enhance system performance and user experience
Perform rigorous testing, troubleshooting, and validation to confirm successful data transfers and resolve anomalies
Create reports, dashboards, and documentation to monitor progress and outcomes of migration efforts


Requirements


5+ years of experience in data analytics or ETL/data integration roles
Expertise in Workday Data Gathering Workbooks and EIB creation, configuration, and troubleshooting
Strong background in data mapping, transformation logic, and bulk uploads into Workday HCM modules
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data analysis tools
Excellent communication skills to work across functional teams and document processes
Ability to interpret complex data models and translate business needs into technical solutions


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Posting Description

ASSOCIATE DATA ANALYST, Credit Union, supports organization business and department objectives through collecting, evaluating and reporting member and sales data. With guidance from AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support the ADA will help maintain Arkalytics (DataLake), DNA CRM/BI tool and all data related systems to help research trends, support opportunities and measure program effectiveness; proactively support outreach programs through any type of list generation and providing ad-hoc analysis; ensure consistency within the organization in applying a set of projects and process improvement standards; and share knowledge, provide, and serve as resource to project teams and management on tools, methods and best practices.

The Full Job Description Is Available Here.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of two years of administrative and/or project/program management experience; effective mathematical, language, problem solving, reasoning, writing and basic to complex numeric skills; intermediate to advanced SQL skills for data extraction and analysis; experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel (pivottables, macros, advanced formulas); ability to handle multiple projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment; and excellent typing, interpersonal and organizational skills. Job #25065-6

This hybrid role requires on-site presence. Employees are expected to work 3 days in the office and 2 days remotely each week.

7/11/2025

Title: Finance & Data Analyst
Description:
Finance & Data Analyst - Workplace

As the Finance & Data Analyst for our Americas Workplace team, you will be responsible for providing financial insights, reporting, modeling, and data analysis to guide decision -making related to real estate, facilities operations, capital projects, and workplace experience initiatives for our 28 locations across the Americas. Reporting into the Workplace Strategy Lead, the ideal candidate will combine financial acumen with a strategic mindset to help analyze data points, make insights easy to understand, and recommend ways to optimize space, spend and service delivery across workplace portfolio.

What You’ll Be DOING

What will your essential responsibilities include?


Support budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning for workplace operations, capital projects, leases and vendor contracts.
Build and maintain financial models to assess real estate strategies, space utilization, sustainability investments and operational efficiency.
Provide analysis of actuals vs budget and identify cost-saving opportunities across workplace spend. Complete quarterly accruals.
Partner with the Workplace, Finance, and Procurement teams to evaluate lease finances, business cases, ROI and performance metrics for workplace purchasing and initiatives.
Develop reporting dashboards and presentations on KPIs to communicate insights to senior leadership.
Perform regular reporting on sustainability metrics and targets as required.
Manage lease accounting and rent processing for all leased Americas locations. Familiarity with IFRS 16 is a plus!
Support workplace procurement processes, vendor contract analysis and spend reviews. Identify and execute opportunities for vendor consolidation and volume discounting across the Americas portfolio.
Contribute to strategic planning for office footprint and workplace experience programming and improvements.


What You Will BRING

We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:

Required Skills And Abilities


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business or related field.
Moderate experience in financial analysis, corporate strategy, or business planning, ideally supporting operations, real estate or facilities.
Effective financial modeling and data analysis skills.
Familiarity with workplace or real estate strategy and facilities KPIs
The ability to work from our office 4 days a week


Who WE Are

AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.

With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.

Learn more at axaxl.com

What we OFFER

Inclusion

AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic. At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and enables business growth and is critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most inclusive workforce possible, and create a culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.


Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter


Learn more at Inclusion & Diversity at AXA XL | AXA XL. AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Total Rewards

AXA XL’s Reward program is designed to take care of what matters most to you, covering the full picture of your health, wellbeing, lifestyle and financial security. It provides competitive compensation and personalized, inclusive benefits that evolve as you do.

We’re committed to rewarding your contribution for the long term, so you can be your best self today and look forward to the future with confidence.

Sustainability

At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.

Our Pillars


Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society - are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature - from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard - by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day - the Global Day of Giving.


For more information, please see Sustainability at AXA XL.

The U.S. base salary range for this position is $53,100 to $84,000 USD.

Actual pay will be determined based upon the individual’s skills, experience and location. We strive for market alignment and internal equity with our colleagues’ pay.

At AXA XL, we know how important physical, mental, and financial health are to our employees, which is why we are proud to offer benefits such as a competitive retirement savings plan, health and wellness programs, and many other benefits. We also believe in fostering our colleagues' development and offer a wide range of learning opportunities for colleagues to hone their professional skills and to position themselves for the next step of their careers. For more details about AXA XL’s benefits offerings, please visit US Benefits at a Glance 2025.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Shields Health Solutions, we pride ourselves on our culture of inclusion, kindness, acceptance, and the difference we make in patients' lives every day. We are tremendously proud to consistently be certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’ several years in a row; we’ve been recognized as a Fortunes Best Workplaces in Healthcare™, Millennials™, and Women™; and a Becker’s Healthcare Top 150 Workplace.

Patients are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to improving lives by ensuring seamless access to specialty medications, better health outcomes, and an enhanced care experience. That’s why more health system leaders trust us to deliver personalized support and comprehensive solutions that make specialty pharmacy more accessible for the patients who need it most. Through our proven Shields Performance Platform, we help drive the financial sustainability of health systems while prioritizing best-in-class outcomes that patients deserve. With a team of leaders in specialty pharmacy, a track record of success partnering with over 80 health systems, and an unwavering dedication to measurable results, we empower health systems to transform their specialty pharmacy into a driver of growth—ensuring every patient receives the best possible care.

As Shields Health Solutions continues to experience rapid growth and expand our partnerships with leading health systems across the country, we’re actively hiring to support our mission. Our expanding footprint means more opportunities to make a meaningful impact in patients’ lives—so we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team and continue to grow with us.

HYBRID IN STOUGHTON, MA

Position Overview:

Shields Health Solutions is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Financial Analytics team, reporting to the Manager of Financial Analytics. This position involves developing and maintaining dashboards and reporting through Tableau and Excel to provide insight into the organization’s performance. Along with this, the Data Analyst will partner directly with department heads to perform weekly and monthly analyses along with ad hoc reporting to identify organization insight. They will proactively recommend reporting, process, and infrastructure improvements. They will automate business and reporting processes and partner with internal teams to improve workflow. This role offers visibility across the corporate team and interaction with key business leaders to support critical business processes, information generation, and insights.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with complex data, excellent communication skills, and possess advanced-level Tableau and Excel skills.

Key Responsibilities


Perform weekly and monthly reporting updates, ensuring data quality and availability
Be responsible for the development and maintenance of Tableau dashboards and Excel reports
Partner with functional leaders to uncover and capture opportunities to improve organizational efficiency
Proactively identify and communicate new ideas or enhancements to existing reports, metrics, and analyses to measure and track business performance
Assist in developing automated reporting processes to streamline analysis
Become a subject matter expert and make recommendations to impact tracking of information necessary to drive business results
Develop and maintain technical documentation to describe and memorialize information with respect to systems, reporting or data
Troubleshoot reporting and process issues, test and work with business to resolve any issues
Support team & organizational goals as needed


Education & Experience


2+ years of experience as data or business intelligence analyst, developer, or engineer
2+ years of developing dashboard, reporting and data processes using Tableau and Tableau Prep
Experience in communicating insight and technical processes to non-technical and executive audiences
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience in owning reporting products and driving development projects
Must be a highly motivated, results-driven professional with an entrepreneurial attitude who can thrive in a team-oriented environment
Growth-oriented and positive, problem-solving mindset
Highly analytical with strong attention to detail; methodical thinker
Effective at multi-tasking; someone who enjoys and thrives wearing multiple hats at once, seeks exposure to different perspectives, and learning new skills
Customer service oriented, flexible and adaptable with proven ability to solve problems in a collaborative manner with strong ability to influence
Experience with Python and R a plus


Education:


Bachelor’s Degree in STEM, finance, business administration, or computer science required
Advanced degree a plus


California residents employed by or applying for work at Shields have certain privacy rights. Please review our: California Workforce Privacy Notice and Privacy Policy.

Shields Health Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in STEM, finance, business administration, or computer science required
  • Advanced degree a plus

California residents employed by or applying for work at Shields have certain privacy rights. Please review our: California Workforce Privacy Notice and Privacy Policy.

Shields Health Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Insight Data Analyst
Description:
Your role at Dynatrace

As a Data Analytics Consultant II, you’ll work with some of the largest sites on the web across major industries (retail, auto, finance, travel, etc.) and help to answer questions about site performance and user engagement, which drives improved customer experience for their customers and improves the client’s overall business.

Dynatrace’s tools generate mountains of data, a lot of which clients don’t know how to make use of…that’s where you come in. You will turn that mountain of data into invaluable insight. As someone who lives and breathes data, analysis and problem solving, you will help your clients understand the right performance data, in the right context. You’ll turn that data into business altering insight which enables your client to take the right action to improve overall site performance and user experience that maximizes business outcomes.

You will help clients set a strategy for how they can optimize both their current performance and build performance into their culture. Responsibilities include:


Account management for up to 8 clients, including managing the relationship and customer expectations, providing value and helping to grow your accounts; running all customer touchpoint meetings
Working as an extension of your client's team and the Dynatrace product through ad-hoc analysis, testing initiatives, configuring Dynatrace offerings to get to answers faster, and training and enablement
Creating detailed analysis for your clients by finding answers from the Digital Experience and Business Analytics data through reporting, dashboarding, or technology expertise
Representing your client within the rest of Dynatrace for Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) issues
Additional responsibilities include working with our team to improve process, identify training gaps and share ideas


What Will Help You Succeed

Minimum Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative disciplines is required.
3- 5 years of experience with data analysis, including looking at and distilling complex sets of data and presenting findings in an engaging way


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in data driven analysis - excellent at working with, understanding, analyzing data
Strong understanding of web technologies including HTML, JS, CSS, networking, Content Delivery Networks, Cloud; basic understanding of Chrome Dev and Webpage test
Proficient with analysis tools including Google Analytics, Adobe, Advanced Excel, Tableau, SPSS, R, etc.
Stellar conceptualization and communication skills. Demonstrated ability to bring business and technical people together around clear product concepts, and to motivate them to deliver whole, working solutions
Operates with a customer first focus
Proven ability to work under pressure and to handle multiple conflicting priorities
Recognizes and understands both personal and team dynamics and relationships, is empathetic to stakeholder concerns and effectively influences and persuades
Thinks proactively and tries to develop solutions rather than wait for an answer
Has a desire to learn new technology and deliver successful customer and partner outcomes for stakeholders at all levels
Possesses excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail


Expectation: all Insights team members are expected to travel at least 1 time per year for annual team meetings.

Why you will love being a Dynatracer


A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.

Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice
Show more

Title: Quality Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Quality Data Analyst

Location: Boston, MA (Remote)

Hours: 40 hrs/week

Duration: 6 months (plus possible extension)

Start: ASAP

Interview Process: 2 rounds




*Skills, experience, and other compensable factors will be taken into account when determining pay rate. The pay range provided in this posting is a reflection of a W2 hourly rate; other employment options may be available that may result in pay outside of the provided range.




*Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis




Position Summary:

The Quality Analytics & Data (QUAD) team is responsible for integrating and standardizing operations, processes, information, data, and technology to advance and align the capabilities, competencies, and outputs of Quality (in the areas of GMP, GDP, GCP, GLP, GVP, Research, and Real World Evidence / Data) with high value goals / strategy and other related the clients’ Quality organizations by building a robust data rich landscape that empowers teams through a data-driven decision-making culture.




This individual will manage deliverables as well as advise and support QUAD in design and implementation of quality reports, dashboards, data analytics, and information management tools / technology to enhance decision making, communication, and oversight. This role will be responsible for collaborating across various sub teams, Quality, and analytical / technical business functions to recommend and implement improvements in order to align quality needs and objectives with strategic corporate goals and initiatives.




Key Responsibilities:

• Support activities for the development and advancement of the QUAD analytics and information framework to enable effective quality oversight, governance, communication and data driven decision making.

• Provide design, development oversight to teams in QUAD on technology and key business intelligence initiatives.

• Serves as a business analyst, project/technical lead for process and technology initiatives related to data accessibility, data connectivity and aggregate analytics and reporting.

• Provide data translation support (i.e., translate complex data insights into understandable and actionable information for decision-makers) to teams ensuring quality and business needs and workflows are adequately aligned.

• Monitor and ensure the integrity of key data to create a robust data environment and metrics suite for reporting across the client's development portfolio.

• Support analytics implementation services (i.e., analytics Center of Excellence) including communication, change management, user documentation, and data literacy.

• Serve as subject matter and data expert for specific cross-departmental initiatives.

• Support execution of broader projects and initiatives to help achieve goals and strategic initiatives as well as meet timelines.

• Remain at the forefront of industry specific systems and technologies understanding their applicability and functionality to the analytics strategy within Quality and client.

• Performs other duties as assigned.




Key Technical Knowledge:

• Strong data visualization skills and experience with relevant tools including (Power BI, Snowflake) (R and Python are a plus).

• Advanced Microsoft Office suite (including Teams and SharePoint) and Smartsheet skills.

• Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills, accompanied by Analytical thinking / Data Analysis skills required to make sound decisions.

• Understanding of the principles of GxP good practices (e.g., GCP) and applicable regulations guiding the drug development life cycle.

• Understanding of industry standards for Quality Management Systems and familiarity with technology solutions (e.g., Veeva).

• Effective communication skills to communicate professionally, clearly, concisely, and consistently both verbally and in writing to internal and external customers.

• Ability to work independently with minimal guidance, organizing and prioritizing work effectively for timeliness, accuracy/completeness, and quality.

• Strong leadership, decision-making, project management, and negotiation skills.

• Ability to support data translation efforts working will all levels of data end users. Develops job aids to foster data literacy and delivers one on one and small group facilitation as appropriate.




Education & Experience:

• B.S. in a scientific or quantitative field such as Data Analytics or Data Science (or equivalent degree) and 5-7 years of relevant technical work experience or comparable relevant background.

• Demonstrable experience in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or device industry solving business and/or compliance challenges through the application of analytic approaches strongly preferred.




Notes (from Manager):

Looking for a Power BI developer with a business analyst mindset - this person will be doing a mix of creating queries and having to interpret & communicate date
Data visualization - using Power BI - all of Vertex has moved to Power BI so must have experience with that
Experience with Snowflake - must have
Python / R are nice to have
Fast paced role - must have strong attention to detail
Does NOT need degree in data analyst work - if they have completed a bootcamp of some sort & have the years of experience that works
Pharma / Biotech industry experience is IDEAL
Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
About

Candex is a rapidly growing private global B2B fintech company on a mission to reshape the way businesses transact. Our tech-based solution makes purchasing fast and easy for enterprise buyers. Recognized in the ProcureTech 100 for Procurement Innovation, our SaaS Platform and accompanying services completely transform the buying experience for large companies around the globe. Buyers enjoy the simplicity of Candex for their purchases, vendors get paid faster, and procurement teams love the increased control they gain over purchases — Everyone wins!

We serve companies in the Global 2,000 and our existing clients include some of the world’s biggest corporations. We’ve raised over $85M from leading investors including Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, American Express, Altos, Craft, and NFX. Available in almost 50 countries, Candex is expanding our already robust footprint and is looking for ambitious, fun people to join us on our mission to revolutionize the way businesses engage and pay their suppliers.

The Role

The Associate Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Data Analytics team in the development and maintenance of data models, ETL processes, and reporting solutions. They will also be responsible for conducting data analysis to support business decisions and improve operational efficiency.

This role will be based out of our Boston office location, working a hybrid work week between in office and remote.

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain data models and ETL processes
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and relationships
Communicate data findings to business stakeholders
Collect and clean data from a variety of data sources
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis techniques and technologies
Develop, maintain, and automate recurring and ad hoc reports for a multitude of audiences across all regions, and management to support business needs and underwriting results
Utilize various Business Intelligence (BI) tools to develop, support, and enhance reports to meet and anticipate stakeholders changing needs in a data-driven environment
Utilize SQL to identify, extract, interpret, and analyze data for reporting
Provide technical support to using the combination of tools needed to best complete each task, including but not limited to SQL, Tableau, and Excel.
Perform data validations and reconciliations between various sources and reports with precision and attention to detail to ensure deliverables are accurate and effective
Support and enhance the central proprietary database by identifying and integrating data elements necessary to support reporting initiatives


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, computer science)
Experience in finance is nice to have
2 years of experience in data analysis
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and/or similar tools
Intellectual curiosity and a passion for analyzing large volumes of data to generate insights
Solid oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and with a team
Effective time management, with the ability to execute and prioritize multiple projects at the same time


Why Work With Us


We are humble, hungry, intelligent and collaborative
Unlimited PTO and a flexible working environment
We offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account (with an employer contribution)
We also provide Life Insurance, STD and LTD
Wellbeing benefits through Employee Assistance Program, Spring Health and OneMedical
401(K)
Home Office Setup
Team-building off sites and outings


Equal Opportunity Employer

Studies indicate that individuals from marginalized backgrounds, including women, often choose to apply for positions only when they fulfill all listed requirements. However, if you find that this role resonates with you even though you don't match every criterion, we strongly encourage you to get in touch with us. Our commitment to being an equal opportunity employer drives us to cultivate a workplace that celebrates diversity and inclusivity, embracing individuals from various backgrounds. Our hiring process prioritizes skills and abilities, and our wide-reaching outlook is something we take great pride in. Feel free to reach out!
Show more

Title: Market Data Associate
Description:
Bain Capital Overview

With approximately $185 billion of assets under management, Bain Capital is one of the world’s leading private investment firms. We create lasting impact for our investors, teams, businesses, and the communities in which we live. Over four decades we have strategically grown our platform to focus on Private Equity, Growth & Venture, Capital Solutions, Credit & Capital Markets, and Real Assets. Today, our team includes 1,880+ employees in 24 offices on four continents.

We partner differently to help people and companies embrace possibility and realize potential. Founded as a private partnership in 1984, we have fostered a culture of innovation, entrepreneurialism, and agility, empowering our people to define and own their career trajectories. Today, our partnership approach enables us to pursue strategic growth, build enduring relationships with a robust external network, and collaborate across our integrated platform to connect the deep and diverse expertise that unlocks breakthrough insights.

Our people are the heart of our advantage. Colleagues at all levels have a seat at the table as they tackle business challenges with a principal investor mindset. By asking incisive questions, respectfully challenging one another, and remaining intellectually agile, we work together to achieve exceptional outcomes.

For more information visit: Bain Capital.

DESCRIPTION:

The Market Data Associate reports directly to the Market Data Director in the Research & Market Data Services (RDS) department within Platform Services at Bain Capital. Our team provides best-in-class market data services and enables innovated research solutions globally for all investment teams and assets classes across the firm. This includes but is not limited to 3rd party data & research procurement, firmwide access & budget management, vendor selection & onboarding, contract negotiations, vendor risk, and partnering with the broader RDS Research team to support the investment due diligence process. You will be working directly with multiple investment teams, Finance, Legal, IT & Compliance stakeholders, and the RDS global research team in a fast-paced complex environment. This position is critical for maximizing the value of our market data & delivery of research services globally at the firm.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Lead onboarding/offboarding of market data and research services ensuring investment team access needs are supported and issues are resolved in a timely manner. Requires coordination with vendors, internal end-users, internal IT and oversight of outsourced business operation teams supporting workflows.
Serve as a project manager involving key market data initiatives & strategic research projects, e.g. establishing access to research services via OKTA.
Manage RDS internal communications for new hirers regarding access needs.
Responsible for inventory data quality control & license cost allocations in FITS system for budget reporting.
Provide input on market data and research best practices & policies and procurement procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS:


Excellent attention to detail, organizational abilities, project management, and problem-solving skills are critical.
Strong written and verbal communication is required, with the ability to communicate clearly across different audiences globally.
Able to work efficiently in a high-paced environment, and deal with frequent changes or unexpected events while providing a high level of customer service.
Comfortable with ambiguity and enjoy managing multiple projects and complex workflows.
Manage time effectively, multi-task, and meet deadlines with quality and consistency.
Minimum of 1-3 years working in a market data and/or project management role.
Strong Excel skills are necessary.
Undergraduate degree from a respected institution required.
Eager to learn and innovate.


Bain Capital is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Show more
